name: df-ur
comment: Define the multiplicative neutral element of a ring. This definition works by extracting the ` 0g ` element, i.e. the neutral element in a group or monoid, and transferring it to the multiplicative monoid via the ` mulGrp ` function ( ~ df-mgp ). See also ~ dfur2 , which derives the "traditional" definition as the unique element of a ring which is left- and right-neutral under multiplication. (Contributed by NM, 27-Aug-2011.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 27-Dec-2014.)
